attributes.appearances: '''Kullback''' is a minor character in Season 4. He is a wildling serving King-Beyond-the-Wall Mance Rayder.==Biography=====Season 4===After the fight night of the Battle of Castle Black <ref>"The Watchers on the Wall"</ref>, Jon Snow enters the main wildling camp to treat with King-Beyond-the-Wall Mance Rayder. Inside Mance's tent, Mance asks Kullback to pour both of them drinks, and later to get them some food. As Kullback finishes, he leaves his knife sticking in a table, which Jon eyes the entirety of the parley. Soon after, the camp comes under attack from riders of House Baratheon of Dragonstone, and Kullback joins Jon, Mance, and the several other wildlings outside. He is ordered taken into custody by Stannis Baratheon after the fighting ends. <ref>"The Children"</ref>==Appearances==Template:Season Four Appearances

sections.In the books: In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, there is no character named as such among the wildlings or otherwise. Along Mance in his tent are [[Tormund]], [[Varamyr]], Harma Dogshead as well as his wife and Queen, Dalla, and her sister, Val.

'''Kullback''' is a minor character in [[Season 4]]. He is a wildling serving [[King-Beyond-the-Wall]] [[Mance Rayder]].
sections.Notes: * He is named after visual effects producer [[Steve Kullback]].
sections.Biography:
===[[Season 4]]===
After the fight night of the [[Battle of Castle Black]] <ref>"[[The Watchers on the Wall]]"</ref>, [[Jon Snow]] enters the main wildling camp to treat with [[King-Beyond-the-Wall]] [[Mance Rayder]]. Inside Mance's tent, Mance asks Kullback to pour both of them drinks, and later to get them some food. As Kullback finishes, he leaves his knife sticking in a table, which Jon eyes the entirety of the parley. Soon after, the camp comes under attack from riders of [[House Baratheon of Dragonstone]], and Kullback joins Jon, Mance, and the several other wildlings outside. He is ordered taken into custody by [[Stannis Baratheon]] after the fighting ends. <ref>"[[The Children]]"</ref>
